verses.verse: So they will be life to your soul And grace to your neck.
((Ps. 37:24; 91:11, 12); Prov. 10:9) Then you will walk safely in your way, And your foot will not stumble.
When you lie down, you will not be afraid; Yes, you will lie down and your sleep will be sweet.
(Ps. 91:5; 1 Pet. 3:14) Do not be afraid of sudden terror, Nor of trouble from the wicked when it comes;
For the LORD will be your confidence, And will keep your foot from being caught.
(Rom. 13:7; (Gal. 6:10)) Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, When it is in the power of your hand to do so.
(Lev. 19:13; Deut. 24:15) Do not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come back, And tomorrow I will give it,” When you have it with you.
Do not devise evil against your neighbor, For he dwells by you for safety’s sake.
(Prov. 26:17; (Rom. 12:18)) Do not strive with a man without cause, If he has done you no harm.
(Ps. 37:1; Prov. 24:1) Do not envy the oppressor, And choose none of his ways;
For the perverse person is an abomination to the LORD, (Ps. 25:14) But His secret counsel is with the upright.
(Lev. 26:14, 16; Deut. 11:28; Zech. 5:3, 4; Mal. 2:2) The curse of the LORD is on the house of the wicked, But (Job 8:6; Ps. 1:3) He blesses the home of the just.
(James 4:6; 1 Pet. 5:5) Surely He scorns the scornful, But gives grace to the humble.
The wise shall inherit glory, But shame shall be the legacy of fools.
(Security in Wisdom) Hear, (Ps. 34:11; Prov. 1:8) my children, the instruction of a father, And give attention to know understanding;
For I give you good doctrine: Do not forsake my law.
When I was my father’s son, (1 Chr. 29:1) Tender and the only one in the sight of my mother,
(1 Chr. 28:9; Eph. 6:4) He also taught me, and said to me: “Let your heart retain my words; (Prov. 7:2) Keep my commands, and live.
(Prov. 2:2, 3) Get wisdom! Get understanding! Do not forget, nor turn away from the words of my mouth.
Do not forsake her, and she will preserve you; (2 Thess. 2:10) Love her, and she will keep you.
(Prov. 3:13, 14; Matt. 13:44) Wisdom is the principal thing; Therefore get wisdom. And in all your getting, get understanding.
(1 Sam. 2:30) Exalt her, and she will promote you; She will bring you honor, when you embrace her.
She will place on your head (Prov. 3:22) an ornament of grace; A crown of glory she will deliver to you.”
Hear, my son, and receive my sayings, (Prov. 3:2) And the years of your life will be many.
I have (1 Sam. 12:23) taught you in the way of wisdom; I have led you in right paths.
When you walk, (Job 18:7; Ps. 18:36) your steps will not be hindered, ((Ps. 91:11); Prov. 3:23) And when you run, you will not stumble.
Take firm hold of instruction, do not let go; Keep her, for she is your life.
